class Solution(object):
    def sortColors(self, nums):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :rtype: None Do not return anything, modify nums in-place instead.
        """
        self.quickSort(nums, 0, len(nums)- 1)

    def quickSort(self, nums, left, right):
        # ç»“æŸé€’å½’çš„æ¡ä»¶
        if left > right:
            return 

        i = left
        j = right
        tmp = nums[i]

        while i != j:
            # å…ˆåˆ¤æ–­ j å†åˆ¤æ–­ iï¼Œä»æœ«å°¾å¼€å§‹
            # é€’å¢æˆ–é€’å‡æ¡ä»¶ï¼šj > i
            while nums[j] >= tmp and j > i:
                j = j - 1
            while nums[i]  i:
                i = i + 1
            # äº¤æ¢æ¡ä»¶ï¼šj > i
            if j > i:
                t = nums[i]
                nums[i] = nums[j]
                nums[j] = t

        # äº¤æ¢åŸºå‡†æ•°
        nums[left] = nums[i]
        nums[i] = tmp

        self.quickSort(nums, left, i - 1)
        self.quickSort(nums, i + 1, right)

class Solution(object):
    def sortColors(self, nums):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :rtype: None Do not return anything, modify nums in-place instead.
        """
        length = len(nums)
        i = 0
        j = i + 1
        while length > 0:
            while j  nums[j]:
                    tmp = nums[i]
                    nums[i] = nums[j]
                    nums[j] = tmp
                i = i + 1
                j = j + 1
            length = length - 1
            i = 0
            j = i + 1
